It's time for gloating. Our Red Sox have won the World Series, and the citizens of Red Sox Nation are rejoicing. Yay Sox! Yay us!
 
 I caught a ball at a Red Sox game back in 1967. 40 years later I still have that ball....a foul off the screen at Fenway by George Boomer Scott. Those of us who remember that year, and 1986, and all the other years we almost won but didn't, can feel the satisfaction of winning now twice in 4 years.
 
 I don't live in Mass. any longer, but I still live there in my heart.

 Congratulations! 
 
 I've lost interest in baseball somewhat since I'm now much older than the players! emoticon_frazzled I was younger than the players in the seventies though! Do you remember the 75 series? Sox vs. Reds? They came soooo close in that one too. Even if the Reds woulda lost, I'd still say that was one of the best World Series ever! :)

 This feels like the first time they've won the series to me. Four years ago, it was all about the curse. They didn't win the series, they broke the curse. This time, they won the series.
 
 I know that doesn't make sense, but I'm a Sox fan. We don't have to make sense! emoticon_xhoho

If you think what they did was something, just wait till Sunday to see what the Pats do to the Colts. The experts are saying that it is going to be the MOST WATCHED Sporting Event in the history of Sports. And I'm trusting the Patriots to break all NFL records this year. emoticon_xagree

 I'm an original bay stater too. I was a big fan of Carl Yazstremski (YAZ) (in the 60s, gulp!). But as a young adult I moved to NY and they lost the WS in like the last inning (and I lost money on a bet), I got mad at them and became a Yankee fan. But alas the curse is over and they're smokin'!
